mediaType.description:
The MediaType string. This must be a configured media type. 
https://gohugo.io/configuration/output-formats/#mediatype

path.description:
Must be set to a value when there are two or more conflicting mediatype for the same resource. 
https://gohugo.io/configuration/output-formats/#path

baseName.description:
The base output file name used when not using "ugly URLs", defaults to "index". 
https://gohugo.io/configuration/output-formats/#basename

rel.description:
The value to use for rel links. 
https://gohugo.io/configuration/output-formats/#rel

protocol.description:
The protocol to use, i.e. "webcal://". Defaults to the protocol of the baseURL. 
https://gohugo.io/configuration/output-formats/#protocol

isPlainText.description:
IsPlainText decides whether to use text/template or html/template
as template parser. 
https://gohugo.io/configuration/output-formats/#isplaintext

isHTML.description:
IsHTML returns whether this format is int the HTML family. This includes
HTML, AMP etc. This is used to decide when to create alias redirects etc. 
https://gohugo.io/configuration/output-formats/#ishtml

noUgly.description:
Enable to ignore the global uglyURLs setting. 
https://gohugo.io/configuration/output-formats/#nougly

ugly.description:
Enable to override the global uglyURLs setting. 
https://gohugo.io/configuration/output-formats/#ugly

notAlternative.description:
Enable if it doesn't make sense to include this format in an alternative
format listing, CSS being one good example.
Note that we use the term "alternative" and not "alternate" here, as it
does not necessarily replace the other format, it is an alternative representation. 
https://gohugo.io/configuration/output-formats/#notalternative

root.description:
Eneable if this is a resource which path always starts at the root,
e.g. /robots.txt. 
https://gohugo.io/configuration/output-formats/#root

permalinkable.description:
Setting this will make this output format control the value of
.Permalink and .RelPermalink for a rendered Page.
If not set, these values will point to the main (first) output format
configured. That is probably the behavior you want in most situations,
as you probably don't want to link back to the RSS version of a page, as an
example. AMP would, however, be a good example of an output format where this
behavior is wanted. 
https://gohugo.io/configuration/output-formats/#permalinkable

weight.description:
Setting this to a non-zero value will be used as the first sort criteria. 
https://gohugo.io/configuration/output-formats/#weight

description: OutputFormatConfig configures a single output format.
